alert.note: Alert for Buckeye, Avondale; Northwest Valley; Tonopah Desert (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 25 at 6:27PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Maricopa County through 700 PM MST... At 627 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Perryville, or near Buckeye, moving northeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Goodyear, Buckeye, Liberty, Perryville and White Tank Mountain Park. This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 10 between mile markers 111 and 126. AZ Route 85 between mile markers 152 and 154. AZ Route 303 between mile markers 105 and 106. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Buckeye, Avondale; Northwest Valley; Tonopah Desert
